p.s: The question of weatherwhether or not we will learn from the mistakes of our past, which led us to the situation we find ourselves in now, during Covid-19, is two-sided: On one hand, it seems obvious, that we will change our habits.
We have experienced the conditions that Covid-19 brought to us as a global cummunity.

Apart from the fact that many of us have suffered losses, suffered from Covid ourselves or at least having experienced the risk of getting infected, the global communit has experienced how fast globalization can turn into a disadvantage for our lives.
Considering the economic damage that came along with Covid-19 and other pandemics of the past, it may seem reasonable to make a change to how we consume recourcesresources today.
As all of us are affected by a pandemic in a globalized world we would want to change our habits as fast as possible.
Sadly, as we live as a global community, whatever actions we take has it'sits impacts on the rest of the world.
If a country, for example, does not keep to any agreements, considering climate change, the problem becomes a global issue.
Therefore it is important that we act together, which is very hard considering the number of humans and individual opinions that exist.
Personally I think that we will never reach a state in which ourr consumption will be checked.
It is an issue that comes at cost of globalitation, specifically out free trafe markets.
The rules we follow in out country might not appeal to the rules of other countries.
Other countries might not have the same chances to enforce particular rules, due to political instability.
Some countries and markets may not be as strict to check on which products are offered and even if they are, the danger of a human being carrying a disease from one place to another will remain.
At last, even if there were rules, every member of the global community agreed on, illegal markets would remain, potentially causing even larger problems at a global scale than we have.
To conclude, I think that unchecked consumption comes at cost of our globalized world and is hard to be in control of.
